instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power. It only puls 5.14V from ampmeter and 0.16A.

I notice that <SIGNAL>USBC_TA_CC1</SIGNAL>/2 was shorted (0.120 on diode reading) and so I replaced UB300. Now I get 0.546 on diode reading in <SIGNAL>USBC_TA_CC1</SIGNAL>/2, but still no power, and 5.14V on ampmeter.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
I just saw that <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> is missing and all of traces are missing to.

Client says it was on other shop before to do a flexgate, and it stoped working.

Is there any way to bypass <CHIP>U5850</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Being a thermal interface, probably shouldn't stop the board to start.
But if someone made such a damage on the board, you can expect the worst scenario.
I do not recommend to waste time on it...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
